chapter.title: Getting Started
chapter.para: This chapter provides the most basic information on starting &app; and obtaining help. Please proceed to the following chapters for more information.

sect1.title: To Start GRAMPS
sect1.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

listitem.para: The method of starting &app; from the menus may vary from distribution to distribution. On default GNOME desktop, choose Other Gramps.
To start &app; from a command line, type gramps, then press Enter.
If you would like &app; to open a specific database or to import a specific file on startup, you can use the filename as a command line argument:

where filename.grdb is the name of the file you want to open. The command line provides many more ways to start &app; and perform different tasks. The detailed reference to the command line options is found in .

sect1.title: Running GRAMPS for the first time
sect1.para: The first time you run the program, GRAMPS will display the Getting Started dialogs. Follow the directions that guide you through Researcher information, Numerical date formats, Alternate calendar support, and the LDS extensions sections. Most of the dialogs are self-explanatory and will not be covered here.

figure.title: GRAMPS Getting Started Window: Researcher Information

sect1.para: Enter your personal information in the corresponding text entry fields. Although &app; requests information about you, this information is used only so that &app; can create valid GEDCOM output files. A valid GEDCOM file requires information about the file's creator. If you choose, you may leave the information empty, however all the GEDCOM files you export will be invalid.
This information can be entered at any time in the Preferences dialog (see ), under the Database/Researcher Information category.

sect1.title: Choosing a database on startup
sect1.para: If &app; is started without a database selected, the following window will appear prompting you to choose one to open.

If you would like to open an existing database, check the top radio button and click the OK button. You will then be asked to specify the name of your existing database (see ). If you would like to immediately create a brand new database from scratch right away, choose new database (see ).

note.title: Selecting file
note.para: This version of &app; does not require selecting a directory for the database. Please select filename, as you would in any other application.

sect1.title: Obtaining Help
sect1.para: The following items are available from the Help to provide immediate assistance:

listitem.para: Select this item to access this manual in the help browser.
Select this item to read the Frequently Asked Questions about &app; in the browser.
Select this item to open the home page of &app; in your default web browser.
Select this item to direct your web browser to the &app; mailing list archives.
Select this item to file a bug report regarding &app; with the bug tracking system.
Select this item to display the status of loaded plugins.
Select this item to load the example database shipped with &app;. This database is composed of fictitious people and serves as a useful example for learning how to work with &app;.
